Title: Innovative Workforce Activity (USAID/Vietnam)
Description: The United States Agency for International Development’s Mission to Vietnam (USAID/Vietnam) is in the process of gathering information to support the anticipated Innovative Workforce Activity. This potential five-year award will aim to enhance the capacity of Vietnam’s digital workforce and local innovation to meet the demands of a growing digital economy and support the realization of Vietnam’s National Strategy on the Industrial Revolution - 4.0. The purpose of this Request for Information (RFI) is to conduct market research and to obtain input from interested parties. USAID welcomes any information and any relevant general feedback and comments that partners may wish to share. Attachment 1 below includes a draft activity description. Attachment 2 contains specific questions and response submission guidelines.

Title: NFJD Office & Quarters Roof Repair or Replacement
Description: This pre-solicitation notice is for the repair or re-roofing of the District Office Roof and the Roof Replacement of the 1053 Residence Quarters in the North Fork Ranger District within the Umatilla National Forest, Umatilla and Union counties, Oregon.    The selection process, and evaluation criteria to be addressed, will be outlined in the forthcoming solicitation.  The solicitation will be available for download exclusively via https://www.sam.gov on or about June 23, 2023.  Paper copies of the solicitation will not be issued.  The Government intends to award without discussions, however, reserves the right to conduct discussions should it be deemed in the Government’s best interest. One Firm Fixed-Price (FFP) contract will be awarded.  The contract period of performance is anticipated from August to October 2023     The magnitude of this construction project is between $ 100,000 and $250,00.   All offerors will be required to provide a Bid Bond (20%) with their proposal submission.  Performance and Payment Bonds (100% each) will be required of the successful awardee. Note: Per FAR 52.204-7(b)(1), System for Award Management (SAM), an Offeror is required to be registered in SAM when submitting an offer and shall continue to be registered until the time of award, during the performance, and through final payment for any contract resulting from this solicitation. Information on registration may be obtained via: https://www.sam.gov. All Offerors must complete the electronic version of the Representations and Certifications in the SAM system.  If at the time of receipt of offers, an Offeror is not actively and successfully registered in the SAM database, the Offeror will not be considered for award. This announcement serves as the Pre-Solicitation notice only. Responses to this synopsis are not required.

The selected Offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions, which are incorporated herein by reference: FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition; FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications - Commercial Items - the selected offeror must submit a completed copy of the listed representations and certifications; FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items; FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, paragraph (a) and the following clauses in paragraph (b): 52.222-21, 52.222-26, 52.222-35, 52.222-36, 52.222-37, 52.225-13, 52.232-34. The full text of the referenced FAR clauses may be accessed electronically at https://www.acquisition.gov/far/.

Title: Pasteurized Process American Cheese and Kosher Certified Process Cheese Product
Description: The Agricultural Marketing Service has posted an updated Pasteurized Process American Cheese and Kosher Certified Process Cheese Product CRD May 2023. Primary updates include kosher language modifications.

Title: Final Chicken Strips, Fully Cooked, Frozen Federal Purchase Program Specification (FPPS)
Description: The Agricultural Marketing Service has posted an updated Chicken Strips, Fully Cooked, Frozen Federal Purchase Program Specification (FPPS).  Primary updates include increasing the date processed from 60 days to 90 days, allow the use of antimicrobial agent(s) in the marinating solution, adding the grading or auditing certification option and Contractor Checkloading, and discontinuation of Supplement 801.  The Supplement for Chicken Products August 2022 replaces Supplement 801.

Title: 5 year ID/IDQ Contract for Animal Ear Tags
Description: The formal solicitation is now open for  the new 5 year ID/IDQ Contract  for Animal Ear Tags at  SAM.gov   Interested vendors please submit  Quotes  to the  Contracting Officer  via Email, (only) below on or before 07/14/2023 by 4:00  pm Mountain  Time. **Please use solicitation number on subject line when responding** Submit questions to carol.dingess@usda.gov. Questions should be submitted no later than  8am 06/22/2023 to ensure adequate time is available to respond and to amend the solicitation if necessary If an interested party’s quote  package  has not completed all of the items listed on the first page of the sf1449_12639523Q0177 form - Instructions, the quote  may be considered incomplete for evaluation purposes and no further consideration will be given, thereby making quote ineligible for award. The Federal Government is not responsible for notifications to interested parties regarding the issuance of  the solicitation nor any of its amendments.  It is the interested parties’  responsibility to check the  web site https://sam.gov    periodically for updates.

Title: USDA Forest Service National Interagency Fire Center (NIFC) - 2022 Call When Needed (CWN) Mobile Food Service Units (MFSU) Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA)
Description: AMENDMENT (A04): The purpose of this amendment is to: A) Provide responses to Questions received. ------------------------------------------------------------------------- AMENDMENT (A03): The purpose of this amendment is to: A) Update BPA Line-Item Number (CLIN) Structure. B) Annually -      i. Offer current BPA holders an opportunity to revise their Unit pricing, update any technical information, or add additional Units to their BPA (see C.2.4.4 USDA FS Custom Clause #4 & E.1 FAR 52.212-1 Instructions).      ii. Provide new contractors an opportunity to submit offers in accordance with the solicitation and any amendment. C) Set Offer Due Date (see E.1 FAR 52.212-1). D) Update the Statement of Work (SOW) and Terms & Conditions -      i. Solicitation - Amendment 03 attachments updated for this amendment; all other previously attached solicitation documents are rescinded.      ii. Provisions and Clauses: FAC 2023-02 / Effective 3/16/2023. E) Clarifications - this Solicitation has been updated to utilize current available technology and will be completed primarily via electronic forms. While it is the government's intent to minimize undue administrative burden in the  solicitation process, it is imperative Offerors follow instructions provided in E.1 FAR 52.212-1 Instructions to Offerors-Commercial Products and Commercial Services. NOTE: Submitted Quotes that do not follow the Instructions may be excluded from consideration. F) Initial quote submissions in consideration of receiving a BPA shall include the SF-1449 (Ex. 13) and subsequent 2023 SF-30s starting with Amendment 03 (Ex. 14). Annual Reviews will submit subsequent 2023 SF-30s starting with Amendment 03. G) In accordance with E.2.4.3 AGAR 452.347-71 Pre-Bid/Pre-Proposal Conference (Feb 1988), (c)  In order to facilitate conference preparations, it is requested participants who expect to attend the Pre-Proposal conference complete the registration. The conference is scheduled for Friday, June 2, 2023 at 1:00 PM MDT (3:00 PM EDT). An invitation will be sent to the email utilized in the RSVP. ------------------------------------------------------------------------- Amendments A01 & A02 are historical reference ONLY. AMENDMENT (A02): The purpose of this amendment is to extend quote due date, update Terms & Conditions (FAR 52.212-1 & 52.212-4) and provide further clarification/instructions on CWN MFSUs.      This combined synopsis/solicitation document is the only attachment for this amendment, al       other solicitation documents remain unchanged. Update Terms & Conditions – AGAR Provision 452.222-71 Past Performance Labor Law Violations (addendum to FAR 52.12-1) and AGAR Clause 452.222-70 Labor Law Violations (addendum to FAR 52.212-4) have been rescinded. These changes will be reflected in subsequent awards. Quote Due Date & Time – Extended to 5/2/2022 @ 5p MDT. Clarifications – Exhibit 12. CWN MFSU Description & Equipment Requirements Checklist- Inspections – Before a certificate of compliance is issued authorizing performance on a BPA, a site inspection may be conducted either in-person or via other electronic methods to determine the unit is suitable for award. Further, photos are necessary to support this exhibit for evaluation purposes. Geographic Area Coordination Center (GACC) – Dispatch center for Regional/Local incidents (< 150 meals). Have access to NICC Source List for 2022 CWN MFSU BPAs. GACCs DO NOT have authority to place Orders under the BPAs. Resource Orders received from GACCs will result in separately priced EERAs written by a Buying Team or Local Contracting Office. National Interagency Coordination Center (NICC) – Only agency other than the CO with authority to place orders under the BPAs. Emergency Equipment Rental Agreement (EERA) – It is the governments intent to not issue EERAs for Call When Needed (CWN) MFSUs responding in support of an incident due to National MFS Units being fully committed or otherwise unavailable during the 2022 Fire Season. The purpose of 1202SC22Q2100 is to award Blanket Purchase Agreements (BPAs) prior to the season in an effort to provide a more efficient dispatch process throughout, especially at times when there is an utmost need, similar to, and in-line with, current National dispatch procedures. This will eliminate time of order negotiations, allowing for quicker response to an incident.  Regional/Local incidents (<150 meals) – Dispatched via GACC via EERAs from regional/local offices or buying teams. GACCs will have access to the source list comprised of all Call When Needed (CWN) MFSU BPA awardees and will follow their own ordering procedures. Regional/local incidents are separate from the CWN MFSU BPA; EERA pricing is determined at time of order based on discussions at that time with that ordering official and will not be reflected against a BPA. Western United States – All states west of ND, SD, WY, CO, NM (occasionally TX and MN). Again, Call When Needed BPAs are for use only when a National MFS is not available. ------------------------------------------------------------------------- AMENDMENT (A01): The purpose of this amendment is to update Exhibit 11: Vendor Forest Service Incident Payment Information and provide clarification on CWN MFSUs. All other solicitation documents remain unchanged / there are no attachments for this amendment. Update Invoice Issues - invoice status questions email to asc_support@usda.gov. This change will be reflected in subsequent awards. This combined synopsis/solicitation is specifically for CWN MFSUs for use after all Nationally contracted MFSUs have been ordered or determined unavailable. GACCs can access a CWN MFSU BPA source list for regional/local use. USDA Forest Service CWN MFSU BPA holders are not precluded from accepting orders from GACCs on a separate EERA: CWN MFSUs are not required to provide pricing matching current BPA prices. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- BASE: This combined synopsis/solicitation and resultant Blanket Purchase Agreements (BPAs) are to provide Call When Needed (CWN) Mobile Food Service Units (MFSUs) at various field locations during wildland fire and other types of incidents throughout the contiguous western United States after all Nationally contracted MFSUs have been ordered or determined unavailable, and as the need becomes known to the Government. The expectation and desired result of the attached Statement of Work (SOW) is to provide appetizing, nutritional, well-balanced hot/cold meals, sack lunches, hot/cold can meals and supplemental items. All meals are to be freshly prepared at the incident (please see the SOW for complete details). This acquisition will result in commercial, multiple-award BPAs, under the authority of Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR), Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Products and Commercial Services in conjunction with FAR Part 13, Simplified Acquisition Procedures. The BPA’s may be used by multiple State and Federal wildland fire agencies and will result in multiple agreements. The dollar limitation for any individual order is the Simplified Acquisition Threshold (SAT) ($7.5M IAW Agency procedure). Since the needs of the Government and availability of Contractor's resources during an emergency cannot be determined in advance, it is mutually agreed that, upon request of the Government, the Contractor shall furnish the resources listed herein to the extent the Contractor is willing and able at the time of order. Due to the sporadic occurrence of incident activity, the placement of any orders IS NOT GUARANTEED. Offerors shall complete the Schedule of Items – CWN MFSUs Item Detail and Price Schedule (attached separately) for the 2022 Calendar Year for all equipment and services they propose to offer. The Contractor is responsible for furnishing and managing all equipment, materials, supplies, trained/certified personnel, laborers, transportation and lodging necessary to meet the agreement specifications as identified in the SOW. Pricing/Terms for subsequent years will be requested annually through an updated combined synopsis/solicitation posted to SAM.gov. The effective period of the resultant BPAs will be June 1, 2022 – May 31, 2032, subject to Annual Review IAW FAR 13.303-6 and custom clause #4. The physical home location of the CWN MFSUs will be considered the Designated Dispatch Point (DDP) for the Offeror’s personnel and equipment. Wildland fire and other types of incidents occur in the contiguous western United States; BPAs will be established with MFS Units located in these areas.

Title: MICROSCOPE SYSTEM: FUSION CAMERA
Description: (i) This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; Quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.  (ii)       This solicitation number  RFQ # 12639523Q0148 is being  issued as a, request for quotation (RFQ) (iii)       In accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) clause 52.252-2 The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular. Applicable FAR clauses are incorporated by reference and may be viewed on the following  website (s) https://www.acquisition.gov/ https://www.dm.usda.gov/procurement/policy/agar_x/agar02/subchaph.html (iv)       This requirement is being issued as  a Small Business Set  set-aside in accordance   with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 52.219-6.   In accordance with Agricultural Acquisition Regulation ( AGAR  )452.219-70   Size Standard and NAICS Code Information : The North American Industrial Classification System Code(s) and business size standard(s) describing the products and/or services to be acquired under this solicitation is listed below: NAICS  334516  Analytical Laboratory Instrument Manufacturing  Size Standard  1,500  Employees (v)        Item Description Firm Fixed Priced purchase of APX100-HCU MICROSCOPE SYSTEM: FUSION CAMERA ®, XAPO OBJ, & PC W/GPU ( Brand Name or Equal IAW FAR 52.211-6)  All cost to include but not limit to: overhead, general and administrative, profit, insurance, and transportation. See Web Page for Salient Characteristics https://www.olympus-lifescience.com/en/solutions-based-systems/apx100/?creative=650987871304&keyword=apx100%20microscope&matchtype=e&network=g&device=c&campaignid=19801273806&adgroupid=149913245514&gclid=EAIaIQobChMIouiT2-H8_gIVYwytBh0vhgTwEAAYAiAAEgJLW_D_BwE (vi)       Description of Requirement: The equipment to be purchased is an all-in-one microscope system:   High quality monochrome camera (CMOS or better) High quality and removable objectives, with high NA Fluorescent light source with LED and LDP Fluorescence cubes (DAPI, CY2, eGFP, CY3, and CY5 capability) Workstation with monitor (equivalent to 32GB, DDR4 RAM, 512 GB SSD, 2TB HDD, NVIDIA RTX A4000 16 GB graphics). Scan times for an entire 20mm X 20mm coverslip: 4x – 26 seconds; 10x – 1 min 5 seconds; 40x – 3 min 20 seconds Installation: In-person installation and training provided by machine-specific technicians and/or   engineers. (vii)      Shipment will be FOB Destination and Inspection and acceptance is in accordance with FAR Clause 52.212-4(a) The Contractor shall assist with property book transactions required to establish the initial accountability for each system delivered. USDA APHIS WS NWRC 4101 Laporte Ave Fort Collins, CO 80521 For Invoice Processing and Payment. Net 15dys ARO in accordance with OMB Dated 06/07/2012  Accelerating Payments to Small Businesses for Goods and Services USDA uses the Invoice Processing Platform (IPP) for electronic submission and tracking of purchase orders, invoices, and payment information to its suppliers of goods and services:  Enroll at https://ipp.gov.  The IPP is a government-wide secure web-based invoice processing service offered free of charge to government agencies and their suppliers by the U.S. Department of Treasury’s Financial Management Service (FMS). Upon contract award, you will receive a notification of your one-time enrollment requirement in an automatic invoice payment notification system available through IPP.  This one-time enrollment in IPP means that you will receive a series of e-mails from Treasury services. Contractors must submit invoices and attach all supporting documentation as required within 5 business days of completion of services provided.   Supporting documentation include ,for example;  maintenance inspection checklist, timecard for labor, travel receipts etc.. The COTR will review the supporting documents before approving invoices in IPP, if supporting documentation is not provided the invoice will be rejected.  IPP will issue a notification to contractor that they must submit supporting documentation and resubmit the invoice. Please see https://www.ipp.gov/vendors/enrollment-vendors.htm and       Submit invoices through the Invoice Processing Platform (IPP)   Enroll at https://www.ipp.gov/   IPP is a secure, web-based system that manages government invoicing. (viii)     52.212?1 Instructions to Offerors – Commercial Items, is replaced in its entirety See addendum. (ix)       Evaluation: Evaluation of quotes will be in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation  ( FAR)  13.106-1 (2) and   (FAR) 13.106-2(b)(3) In accordance with Federal Acquisition ( FAR)  13.106-1 (2)  the Government will award a purchase order  resulting from this solicitation to the responsible Quote conforming to the solicitation that will be the “Best Value” and most advantageous to the Government.  In accordance with FAR 13.106-2 (b)(3);  Product offered, Price, Warranty, and Delivery are the  factors to be  considered.  52.211-6 Brand Name or Equal. (AUG 1999) (a) If an item in this solicitation is identified as "brand name or equal," the purchase description reflects the characteristics and level of quality that will satisfy the Government’s needs. The salient physical, functional, or performance characteristics that "equal" products must meet are specified in the solicitation. (b) To be considered for award, offers of "equal" products, including "equal" products of the brand name manufacturer, must- (1) Meet the salient physical, functional, or performance characteristic specified in this solicitation; (2) Clearly identify the item by- (i) Brand name, if any; and (ii) Make or model number; (3) Include descriptive literature such as illustrations, drawings, or a clear reference to previously furnished descriptive data or information available to the Contracting Officer; and (4) Clearly describe any modifications the offeror plans to make in a product to make it conform to the solicitation requirements. Mark any descriptive material to clearly show the modifications. (c) The Contracting Officer will evaluate "equal" products on the basis of information furnished by the offeror or identified in the offer and reasonably available to the Contracting Officer. The Contracting Officer is not responsible for locating or obtaining any information not identified in the offer. (d) Unless the offeror clearly indicates in its offer that the product being offered is an "equal" product, the offeror shall provide the brand name product referenced in the solicitation. Title: 5 year ID/IDQ Contract for Animal Ear Tags
Description: The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), Animal Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS), Veterinary Services Division (VS), is seeking a contractor(s) to provide the following ear tags for sheep and goats: 1.         Metal alphanumeric serial tags (tamper evident or resistant), OR 2.         Plastic alphanumeric serial tags (tamper evident)Deliveries will be required nationwide. The Contractor(s) shall furnish all the needed supplies, shipping, and equipment, to provide the ear tags including applicators and provide the proper reporting for all orders in an APHIS database (Animal Identification Management System) and receipting in the Government Invoice Processing Platform. The award of one or more Firm-Fixed Price Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) commercial supply contract(s) are anticipated for these ear tags. The anticipated period of performance for this contract is five years from the date of award. This requirement will  be issued as  a Small Business Set  set-aside in accordance   with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 52.219-6.   In accordance with Agricultural Acquisition Regulation ( AGAR  )452.219-70   Size Standard and NAICS Code Information : The North American Industrial Classification System Code(s) and business size standard(s) describing the products and/or services to be acquired under this solicitation is listed below: NAICS 332999   All Other Miscellaneous Fabricated Metal Product Manufacturing  Size Standard 750 Employes Interested parties must be approved scrapie program tag manufacturers and the tags and applicators (devices) offered. must be approved scrapie program devices, or the offerors must have submitted an acceptable application for. approval prior to award.  Please contact Diane Sutton at (301) 851-3509 or Diane.L.Sutton@aphis.usda.gov for questions regarding becoming an approved scrapie program ear tag manufacturer. The Government intends to provide the full package for solicitation number 12639523Q0177 and all amendments via this web site.   The Federal Government is not responsible for notifications to interested parties regarding the issuance of  the solicitation nor any of its amendments.  It is the responsibility of interested parties to check this website periodically for updates.    Telephone and email requests will not be accepted Anyone  interested in doing business  with the USDA must also first  be listed in the government’s System for Award Management  known as SAM.gov.  You may register on line with www.SAM.gov.     A prospective awardee shall be registered in the SAM database prior to award, during performance and through final payment of any contract resulting from a formal solicitation.   Interested persons  may obtain information on registration and annual confirmation requirements via the SAM database accessed through http://sam.gov  or by calling  1-866-606-8220 ***REGISTRATION IS FREE***

Title: USDA Food Supply Chain Fellows Initiative
Description: USDA is committed to the vital work of transforming our?nation’s?food system to one that offers new market opportunities to small and mid-sized farming operations through a strengthened local and regional food system. ?USDA is also committed to ensure that this strengthened local and regional food system is developed in a way that?supports accessibility to USDA?financial and technical assistance programs?by?underserved producers and communities?through strategic partnerships that build capacity on the ground.? As part of this work, USDA may establish?agreements and programs?to help ensure that skilled personnel from state and local governments, Indian tribal governments, institutions of higher education and other eligible organizations may share and transfer expertise to help achieve the goals?of USDA’s Food Systems Transformation efforts?through the set up and execution of?a Food Supply Chain Fellows Initiative that will support key local and regional programs.?? For?these programs to be successful, USDA will need to identify and support talented individuals with the key skills?and?food systems expertise to assist USDA in coordinating?locally and regionally based programs?with its partners and to?provide?technical assistance to?help?small and mid-sized producers to access new markets and leverage public resources?to expand and improve markets for domestically produced?products.?The volume of skilled talent needed to support these significant efforts can only be found through collaboration with?external?partners to make these programs happen across the country, drawing from local and regional talent to bridge?coordination and oversight activities alongside USDA employees. If you are interested in the USDA’s Food Supply Chain Fellows Initiative, please let USDA know by contacting askusda@usda.gov.

Title: 23--New UTV (EN2628) for San Juan National Forest
Description: AMENDMENT NOTICE: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is 1240LQ23Q0029 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2023-03. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 336999 with a small business size standard of 1,000.00 employees. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified offerors may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2023-06-02 16:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be Durango, CO 81301 The USDA Forest Service Region 2 - Forest Service requires the following items, Meet or Exceed, to the following: LI 001: Purchase of a new UTV with FOB Destination per specifications in attachment. Please review and return the Solicitation with delivery date and Reps & Certs noted. The completed Solicitation should be attached to your quote. All questions shall be sent through this Unison Marketplace posting. PLEASE NOTE MAXIMUM WIDTH OF MACHINE SHALL BE 52"., 1, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested offerors must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, USDA Forest Service Region 2 - Forest Service intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. USDA Forest Service Region 2 - Forest Service is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerors that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerors that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerors that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerors may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should offerors require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. New Equipment ONLY; NO remanufactured or "gray market" items. All items must be covered by the manufacturer's warranty. Bid MUST be good for 30 calendar days after close of Buy. Shipping must be free on board (FOB) destination CONUS (Continental U.S.), which means that the seller must deliver the goods on its conveyance at the destination specified by the buyer, and the seller is responsible for the cost of shipping and risk of loss prior to actual delivery at the specified destination. This solicitation requires registration with the System for Award Management (SAM) at the time an offer or quotation is submitted, excluding the exceptions outlined in FAR 4.1102(a). Registration information can be found at www.sam.gov. The selected Offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions, which are incorporated herein by reference: FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition; FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications - Commercial Items - the selected offeror must submit a completed copy of the listed representations and certifications; FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items; FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, paragraph (a) and the following clauses in paragraph (b): 52.222-21, 52.222-26, 52.222-35, 52.222-36, 52.222-37, 52.225-13, 52.232-34. The full text of the referenced FAR clauses may be accessed electronically at https://www.acquisition.gov/far/. 452.204-70 Modification for Contract Closeout (DEVIATION JUL 2022) Upon contract closeout for contracts utilizing Simplified Acquisition Procedures (SAP) according to FAR 13: (a) If unobligated funds in the amount of $1000 or less remain on the contract, the Contracting Officer (CO) shall issue a unilateral modification for de-obligation. The contractor will receive a copy of the modification but will not be required to provide a signature. The CO shall immediately proceed with contract closeout upon completion of the period of performance, receipt and acceptance of supplies or services, and final payment. (b) If unobligated funds of more than $1000 remain on the contract, the CO shall issue a bilateral modification for de-obligation. The contractor will receive a copy of the modification and will be required to provide a signature. (The CO may also request a Release of Claims be completed by the contractor, although not required for contract and orders using SAP procedures.) If the bilateral modification and Release of Claims are not returned to the CO within 60 days, the CO shall release the modification as unilateral and proceed with contract closeout upon completion of the period of performance, receipt and acceptance of supplies or services, and final payment.

Title: Notice of Intent to Award a Sole Source Contract - LTFR Integrated Operational Field Evaluation
Description: 25 May 2023 - Update Justification and Approval posted. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- THIS IS A NOTICE OF INTENT TO AWARD A SOLE-SOURCE CONTRACT – THIS IS NOT A REQUEST FOR COMPETITIVE PROPOSALS The U.S. Department of Agriculture, Forest Service (USDA FS), Procurement & Property Services (PPS), Incident Procurement Organization (IPO) intends to award a sole source Indefinite-Delivery, Indefinite-Quantity contract to Fortress Fire Retardant Systems (Fortress) for a limited supply of Fortress fully qualified aerial Long-Term Fire Retardant (LTFR) products and ancillary product support to the USDA FS at various Airtanker base (ATB) locations, for the purpose of performing an Integrated Operation Field Evaluation. Award will be via modification to existing contract 1202SC21T4001 for Operational Field Evaluations. The USDA FS is continually reviewing, testing and sourcing new LTFR products and suppliers to increase capable sources of supply, to continue to meet greater wildland fire demands and continue to exceed changing environmental regulations. The LTFR aerial product required and supplied must be Fortress fully qualified aerial LTFR products on the Qualified Products List (QPL) in accordance with USDA, USFS Specification 5100-304d (or latest version) - Long Term Retardant, Wildland Firefighting with amendments. The statutory authority permitting other than full and open competition is 41 U.S.C. 3304(a)(1), (FAR 6.302-1) Only one responsible source and no other suppliers or services will satisfy the agency requirements. This notice of intent is NOT a request for proposals or quotes. Within 5 calendar days of this posting, all interested and responsible sources, meeting the stated requirement above, including providing Fortress fully qualified aerial LTFR products, may contact the Contracting Officer (via email only) in writing. All responsible sources may submit a capability statement, proposal or quotation, which shall be considered by the agency. If no written responses are received within 5 calendar days of the publication of this notice, the modification to the contract will be awarded without further notice and a redacted copy of the justification will be posted within 14 days of the contract modification date. A determination by the Government not to open the requirement to competition based upon the responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. Please contact the Contracting Officer with any questions or concerns. Primary Point of Contact.: Larry J. Robillard, Contracting Officer larry.robillard@usda.gov Phone: 208-407-6003
NAICS: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

Title: Smokejumper MTDC-1125a Drogue Parachute Assemblies
Description: Update on 22 May 2023: Drogue parachute drawings are available upon request after a non-disclosure agreement (see Attachments/Links section) is filled out, signed, and returned to Gwendolynn Boyle.  Please send an e-mail request to Gwendolynn.Boyle@usda.gov with the non-disclosure agreement attached.  The deadline to respond to this special notice has been extended from 23 May 2023 at 1400 MDT to 30 May 2023 at 1400 MDT. Original Posting on 9 May 2023: Notice of Sole Source Intent.  This requirement is for commercial items as defined in FAR 2.101 and will be prepared in accordance with the information in FAR Subpart 13.5, as supplemented with the additional information included in this notice.  This notice of intent is not a competitive solicitation or request for quotes. No solicitation package is available. The U. S. Department of Agriculture, Forest Service (USFS), intends to award a contract to G7T, LLC for MTDC-1125a drogue parachute assemblies.  The USFS has found G7T to be the only reasonably available source to successfully supply the required parachute assemblies for smokejumper operations.  The resulting contract will be for a 12-month base period and include four (4) additional 12-month option periods; to be exercised at the USFS’ discretion.  Since the USFS’ initial market research indicates that only one responsible source can provide the parachute assemblies that will satisfy the Agency's requirements, a sole source justification is being prepared.  The USFS anticipates award before 1 July 2023 with services to begin no later than 1 August 2023. Contractors that have questions regarding the sole source nature of this requirement or Contractors who believe they can provide the required parachute assemblies are encouraged to identify themselves and give written notification to the Contracting Officer.  All responsible sources may submit a capability statement, proposal, or quotation, which shall be considered by the USFS.  Any response to this notice shall show clear and convincing evidence that competition would be advantageous to the Government.  Responses to this notice can be emailed to Gwendolynn.Boyle@usda.gov. All responses must include the Contractor's Unique Entity ID (UEI) and Tax Identification Number (TIN).  Contractors must additionally identify themselves as either a small business or other than small business under North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code 314999, All Other Miscellaneous Textile Product Mill, Parachutes Manufacturing.  The applicable small business size standard is 500 employees.  The Product Service Code is 1670 Parachutes:  Aerial Pick Up, Delivery, Recovery Systems; and Cargo Tie Down Equipment. A determination by the USFS not to compete this proposed action, based on the responses to this notice, is solely within the discretion of the USFS.  Information received will be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether or not to conduct a competitive procurement. Any Contractor interested in conducting business with the Federal Government must be registered and active in the System for Award Management (SAM.gov) prior to submitting a response.  SAM.gov is a FREE, Federal Government-owned and operated website at https://sam.gov/content/home. By submitting a response, the Contractor is self-certifying that neither the principal corporate official(s) nor owner(s) is currently suspended, debarred, or otherwise ineligible to receive contracts from any federal agency.  Failure to do so may represent grounds for refusing to accept the response.  By submission of a response, the Contractor acknowledges the requirement that a prospective awardee shall be registered in the SAM.gov database prior to award, during performance, and through final payment of any resulting contract.  All invoices for this procurement shall be submitted through the Department of Treasury's Internet Payment Platform located at https://www.ipp.gov. Any questions regarding this proposed action can be directed to Gwen Boyle at Gwendolynn.Boyle@usda.gov.
NAICS: All Other Miscellaneous Textile Product Mills
PSC: PARACHUTE RECOVER SYS & TIE DOWN EQ

Title: Publicity and Press Management
Description: NOTE: This opportunity is for Pakistan-based firms/vendors/contractors/entities only. Publicity and Press Management - SOW Summary - Details are in the attached RFQ Gaining public visibility or awareness through earned media and publicity is an important factor for USAID/Pakistan’s promotional work. The Publicity and Press Manager/Consultant will be responsible for creating and maintaining a favorable public image for USAID/Pakistan by communicating the accomplishments of USAID/Pakistan's projects and activities. The Consultant must possess a university degree in journalism, mass communication, advertising, or a related field; and a minimum of five years of experience as a reporter, editor, media coordinator, TV production or in public relations services is required. The Consultant must have strong connections with leading media outlets in order to generate media attention for events and ensure USAID/Pakistan’s messaging is disseminated appropriately and broadly. Through strong relationships with leading local media outlets, the Consultant will help USAID/Pakistan deliver messages clearly and effectively in English, Urdu, and other local languages. The incumbent must also have solid contacts with the Pakistani print, broadcast, and social media players as he or she will be responsible for pitching stories to the media, preparing media kits, and organizing press tours/events. In addition to writing press releases in regional languages, the incumbent will write speeches and prepare articles for publications, release information to counter negative publicity, and handle crisis and emergency communications. Working closely with the Development Outreach and Communications (DOC) Team, the Consultant is expected to generate quality media coverage of USAID/Pakistan events, paying particular attention to themes designated by USAID/Pakistan and its regional focus areas. The Consultant shall interact with local media contacts regularly, encouraging accurate reporting, process materials, and address any necessary changes to ensure items go to press on time. The consultant will also monitor news for USAID mentions and provide media advisory support on a continuous basis. The Publicity and Press Management services will include, but are not limited to the following four tasks: Managing Press The Consultant is expected to perform the below services: Press events and releases: Identify, invite, and facilitate access for press to publicity and media events, preparing press kits and draft/ translation press releases for distribution, and monitoring press inputs and attendance. Media tours: Plan and execute media tours and visits to USG civilian assistance projects. Media Logistics: Arrange for radio, TV, and print media to cover USG assistance programs. Stories/Articles and News Reports: Coordinate with USAID/Pakistan DOC office to identify and develop success stories to be shared either through print or electronic media. Media Appearances. Arrange radio and TV appearances and print publications at both the national and regional levels.  Media Database: Develop and continuously update a comprehensive database of media contacts by interest, language of publication, and geographic location. Media advisory support: for any related media work such as the TV/ film production.

Title: 1099014 Hermosa AOP Geotechnical Engineering Studies
Description: 1. Introduction.  This pre-solicitation notice is for information only and is not a commitment by the Government to solicit contractual offers or award contracts.  The Government is not soliciting, nor will it accept proposals as a result of this synopsis.  If a competitive solicitation is issued in the future, it will be announced via The System for Award Management (SAM) at SAM.gov and interested parties must comply with that announcement.  The Government will not reimburse respondents for any questions submitted or information provided as a result of this notice.  This is not a solicitation or a promise to issue a solicitation, and this information is subject to modification and in no way binds the Government to award a contract. 2. Applicable North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code.  The applicable NAICS code is 541330. 3. Type of Contract to be Awarded.  As a result of this synopsis and possible solicitation, the Special Project Operations Center, Intermountain Branch, plans to award a firm fixed price contract. 4. Type of Solicitation.  The solicitation, if released, will be governed by Federal Acquisition Regulation Part 15, “Contracting by Negotiation”. 5. Synopsis Posting Period.  This synopsis will be posted for 15 days. 6. Contracting Office Points of Contact.  Traci Jackson, Contracting Officer, Traci.Jackson@usda.gov. 7. Contract Description.  Three Aquatic Organism Passage (AOP) structures are planned to be installed in the Hermosa Creek Watershed. Geotechnical Engineering Studies of these sites will be needed to assist in design characteristics for these structures. 8. Disclosure of Magnitude.  The anticipated magnitude for this project is between $25,000 and $100,000. 9. Type of Set-aside.  Total small business set-aside. 10. Responses.  Interested and capable sources are encouraged to respond to this synopsis with a Statement of Capability.  In addition to a Statement of Capabilities, firms responding to this announcement should include company name, Unique Entity Identification, point of contact, address, and indicate whether they are a small business, 8(a) concern, veteran-owned small business, service-disabled veteran-owned business, HUBZone small business, small disadvantaged business, or women-owned small business.  Responses are due within 15 days of this synopsis and should be submitted to Traci Jackson at Traci.jackson@usda.gov

Title: Five Year BPA to provide biotechnology support services
Description: United States Department of Agriculture Limited Source/Brand Name Justification FAR 13.106-1(b)(1) – Simplified Acquisitions Control No.  PR1086681 Identification of the agency and the contracting activity.  Agency Name APHIS/ USDA/Center for Veterinary Biologics 1800 Dayton Ave Ames, IA 50010 Contracting Activity USDA/APHIS/MRPBS/AAMD 250 Marquette Plaza Ste 410 Minneapolis, MN 55401 Description of supply or service required to meet the agency’s needs. Five year Blanket Purchase Agreement  to provide service and support operations for Biotechnology Services provided by the Iowa State University DNA, Protein, and Genomics facilities. The BPA Ceiling shall be $250,000.00  The rationale or circumstances for limiting competition.  In accordance with FAR FAR 13.106-1(b)(1) The property or services needed by the executive agency are available from only one responsible source and no other type of property or services will satisfy the needs of the executive agency(e.g. urgency, exclusive licensing agreements, brand name or industrial mobilization. Iowa State University is the only facility within the local commuting area,  with impartial interest, instrumentation and knowledge to provide support for genetic analysis of this caliber.  The impartiality and local commuting area is of paramount importance as it impacts the Program’s ability to quickly deliver and retrieve samples that may be needed to diagnose disease in the case of an animal health emergency and speeds NVSL results to their customers.  In addition, the Iowa State University has the staff members, equipment, and capacity to support full service biotechnology needs.   Although there are other facilities that supply portions of the services required, there are no other vendors within the commuting area  of approximately five miles with the resources required to provide the all the services needed.  Based on these considerations, there is only one reasonable source for obtaining these services. This is a follow on BPA from the previous Iowa State University of Science and Technology sole source requirements AG-6395-B-12-0025             01/25/2012 to 12/30/2016  AG-6395-B-17-0023            01/01/2017 to 12/31/2021 A description of the market research conducted and the results or a statement of the reason market research was not conducted.    SAM.gov Sole Source Announcement PR1086681 was published on 01/31/2023 and closed on 02/15/2023.  No response  Estimated price, including all options, if applicable.  In accordance with AGAR Clause  452.216-74 Ceiling Price. (FEB 1988) The ceiling price of this BPA is $ 250,000.00 The Contractor shall not make expenditures or incur obligations in the performance of this contract which exceed the ceiling price specified except at the Contractor's own risk. The contractor shall ensure that all costs for performing under this agreement, including delivery and any other deliverables or requirements set forth in this Agreement , are included in the prices for the supplies ordered.  Shipping and handling costs are to be included in the prices for supplies. USDA/APHIS/NVSL will not be responsible for paying for any costs or prices other than those for the supplies ordered, received and accepted by the USDA/APHIS/NVSL. Any price increases shall be subject to approval by APHIS prior to purchase.  The rates can be found at the following websites under "Fees for Services": DNA Facility: http://www.biotech.iastate.edu/service_facilities/dna.html Protein Facility: http://www.biotech.iastate.edu/service_facilities/protein.html Pricing for BIOINFORMATICS SUPPORT – Can be found under the Genome Informatics Facility website: http://www.biotech.iastate.edu/service_facilities/gif.html
Awardee: Iowa State University of Science and Technology UEI: DQDBM7FGJPC5 Ames IA USA

Title: California Trail Maintenance and Construction BPA
Description: Solicitation 12363N23Q4131 This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial products or commercial services prepared in accordance with the format in subpart  12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation and proposals are being requested.   PROJECT DESCRIPTION: California Trail Maintenance and Construction Blanket Purchase Agreement The California Trail Maintenance and Construction Blanket Purchase Agreement is a National BPA that will consist of a variety of work including both Trail Maintenance service types of work and Trail Construction types of work. The BPA will have a period of performance from early Summer 2023 through early Summer 2033 and can be utilized on all California Federal Forests and Grasslands and is available for all federal agencies to utilize. This solicitation is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ). This solicitation will remain Open and Continuous to add vendors when determined necessary for the 10-year period it is active. Make sure your firm is updated and registered in the System for Award Management system (SAM) and current to conduct government business.  Please read the entire solicitation thoroughly to ensure all requirements in your response are included.  PROJECT LOCATION: Projects shall covers the state of California including the following forests and grasslands; Angeles, Cleveland, Eldorado, Humboldt-Toiyabe, Inyo, Klamath, Lake Tahoe Basin Management Unit, Lassen, Los Padres, Mendocino, Modoc, Plumas, Rogue River-Siskiyou, San Bernardino, Sequoia, Shasta-Trinity, Sierra, Six Rivers, Stanislaus, and Tahoe National Forests and Butte Valley National Grassland. The terrain varies and can have moderate hills on some areas and steep grades in others. Soil conditions vary as well, from soft and sandy to compacted and rocky. Contractors shall furnish all labor, supervision, equipment, materials, transportation, supplies (unless specified elsewhere as Government-furnished), and incidentals required to accomplish specified work in compliance with the terms, specifications, and provisions of the contract. Work is estimated to begin around June 25, 2023. Engineering point of contact is Sally Cousins: (530)-551-1601. NAICS 237990 with size standard $45 mil. This project is set aside 100% for small business.

Title: Sahel Regional Office (SRO) Regional Misinformation, Disinformation, and Malinformation (MDM) in the Sahel
Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) Mission in Senegal / Sahel Regional Office (SRO) is in the early stages of designing a new mis/dis/mal-information (MDM) activity for the Sahel region. To that end, USAID/Senegal/SRO is reaching out to all stakeholders and interested parties to obtain comments and suggestions in order to incorporate relevant information and innovative approaches in the design of a potential activity. By issuing this Request for Information (RFI), USAID/Senegal/SRO will solicit input from the broad community of private sector actors, public institutions, development partners, non-governmental organizations, civil society organizations, industry associations, think tanks, and academia concerned with the issue of mis/dis/malinformation in the Sahel. Comments will be used to inform a design document that is clear, maximizes development impact, facilitates coordination with existing and planned U.S. Government (USG) and USAID activities and other development partner programs, and aligns with the priorities of partner governments.
POC Information: Aminata DIALLO -Regional Acquisition Specialist | Robert Trimble ,Contracting Officer

Title: Eyak River Boat Launch Regrading
Description: The intent of the contract is to provide regrading to the lower section of the Eyak River Boat Ramp.  A brief summary of the project is as follows (a more detailed statement of work will be identified in the forthcoming solicitation packet): --Ensure site and river access is maintained for the public.  A temporary ramp location immediately down river of the boat launch will serve as river access during construction. Ensure this area remains accessible during construction. --Isolate and dewater the in-stream portion of the project site.  Hydraulic bladder dam is the only permitted method for work area isolation and dewatering. Coordinate with the Cordova Ranger District for fish removal during dewatering as the ADF&G Fish Habitat permit requires fish to be removed by District Staff.    --For the regraded section of boat launch, temporarily remove existing concrete planks to on-site staging location and protect planks and rubber spacers from damage. Remaining planks to be fastened in place to prevent movement during construction.   --Provide and place classified fill, geotextile, riprap, and crushed aggregates for regraded section of boat ramp, salvaging existing materials where possible. --Reinstall temporarily removed concrete planks including rubber spacers and ramp terminal end fittings and hardware per new grades.  Provide 4 replacement stainless steel swageless terminal end fittings.   --Provide and place joint aggregate between planks.   Location:  The Eyak River Recreation Area located at approximately milepost 5.9 of the Copper River Highway east of Cordova, Alaska.     The selection process, and evaluation criteria to be addressed, will be outlined in the forthcoming solicitation.  The solicitation will be available for download exclusively via https://www.sam.gov on or about 05/23/2023.  Paper copies of the solicitation will not be issued.  The Government intends to award without discussions, however, reserves the right to conduct discussions should it be deemed in the Government’s best interest. One Firm Fixed-Price (FFP) contract will be awarded.  The contract period of performance will be:  04/15/2024 – 06/15/2024.     The magnitude of this construction project is between $250,000 and $500,000.  All offerors will be required to provide a Bid Bond (20%) with their proposal submission.  Performance and Payment Bonds (100% each) will be required of the successful awardee. Note:  Per FAR 52.204-7(b)(1), System for Award Management (SAM), an Offeror is required to be registered in SAM when submitting an offer and shall continue to be registered until time of award, during performance, and through final payment for any contract resulting from this solicitation.  Information on registration may be obtained via:  https://www.sam.gov.  All Offerors must complete the electronic version of the Representations and Certifications in the SAM system. This announcement serves as the Pre-Solicitation notice only.  Responses to this synopsis are not required.
NAICS: Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction
PSC: REPAIR OR ALTERATION OF RECREATION FACILITIES (NON-BUILDING)

Title: GSER NELDER GROVE STEWARDSHIP IRSC
Description: Background: The GSER Nelder Grove Stewardship IRSC shall be awarded under the following Stewardship Authority: Section 604 (16 USC 6591c) of Public Law 108-148 as amended by Section 8205 of Public Law 113-79, the Agricultural Act of 2014—Grants the U.S. Forest Service (Government) permanent authority to enter into stewardship contracts or agreements to achieve land management goals for the National Forests or public lands that meet local and rural community needs. Section 8205 supersedes the temporary authority granted to the Forest Service (Government) in section 347 of Public Law 105-277, the Omnibus Consolidated and Emergency Appropriations Act, 1999. Multiple Awards MAY be made from this solicitation. Work activities have been designed for individual awards, or all awarded to one contractor if determined best value to Forest Service. ***Draft versions of the contract are being made available to contractors to get familiar with the requirements. These are not the FINAL contract requirements and information contained in these documents is subject to change.  Quotes should not be developed based on the draft information.*** NAICS: 115310: Support Services for Forestry, size standard: $34M Fuels Management Services. Stewardship authorities permit the Government to solicit this requirement as Full and Open competition. Project Location: The GSER Nelder Grove Stewardship IRSC is located in Madera County on the Sierra NF, Bass Lake RD. The project area is 30 minutes northeast of the town of Oakhurst. The project is accessed from Hwy 41 to Skyranch/ 6S10 road. Legal description is T6S R22E, Sections 4, 5, 6, 7, and 9; Mount Diablo Meridian; Madera County, CA. Period of Performance:  All work shall be completed by 12/31/2024. Description of Work: The objective of this project is to provide for the long-term survival of Giant Sequoias by reducing the likelihood and effects of high severity wildfire before it occurs in previously unburned or moderately burned Giant Sequoia groves. Proposed urgent treatments include removal of green and dead surface and ladder fuels from Giant Sequoia Groves to prevent Sequoia trees from torching. Emergency fuels treatments include: Cut and pile dead and dying Conifers. Cutting and piling live trees less than 20” DBH. Piling of all activity created and existing fuels. Mastication of brush. Additional work will include road reconstruction and maintenance of identified roads in the grove. The estimated price magnitude for this work is between $250,000 and $500,000. Estimated Timber Volume and Species composition is as follows, all Timber and Biomass is subject to agreement: Estimated volume for Forest Products in ground-based units: ~2,200 Tons. During solicitation, the Forest will hold a site visit for prospective contractors to facilitate dialogue on contractual requirements that are anticipated in the contract and any operational limitations foreseen by attendees. The site visit will be held on May 26th, 2023, at 9:00a.m. PST with a meeting location at Batterson Work Center, 43060 Highway 41, Oakhurst, CA 93644. Send questions or interest to both Matt Daigle at matthew.daigle@usda.gov  and James Simmons at james.m.simmons@usda.gov. Follow this notice on SAM for future notifications. It is anticipated that the Request for Quotes with all attachments shall be issued on or around May 19, 2023. The contract shall be awarded using a best value source selection method; the resulting contract shall be a firm fixed price commercial services contract.
POC Information: Matt Daigle, Stewardship Acquisition Program Support Officer | Jim Simmons

Title: Fire Cove Remote Dock
Description: The USDA Forest Service intends to issue a Request for Quote (RFQ) for rehabilitation/repair of Forest Service Marine Facilities in Ketchikan. The work is located in Region 10, Tongass National Forest, Ketchikan Misty-Fjords Ranger District within Revillagigedo Island, Southeast Alaska. The major construction efforts include securing services to repair various elements of the Fire Cove dock facilities. This includes but are not limited to dock repair, utility connections, gangway repair, abutments patching, trestle access, float repair/replacement, as well as other incidental waterfront repairs resulting in a safe and fully functional assets suitable for its intended application by the USFS. The above list is not exhaustive but meant to give a general scope of work needed on project site. The contract period of performance will not exceed June 30, 2024.        The magnitude of this construction project is between Between $100,000 and $250,000.  A Bid Bond (20%) will be required of Offerors whose total price offer exceeds $150,000.  Performance and Payment Bonds (100% each) will be required of awardee for award greater than $150,000. Title: Treatment Services and Second Chance Act Goods and Services
Description: THIS IS A PRE-SOLICITATION NOTICE – PROPOSALS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED IN RESPONSE TO THIS NOTICE. ATTENTION VENDORS: TO FIND OUT WHETHER A DISTRICT WILL ISSUE A SOLICITATION FOR TREATMENT SERVICES AND/OR SECOND CHANCE ACT GOODS AND SERVICES, CONTACT THE CHIEF PROBATION OR PRETRIAL SERVICES OFFICER IN THEIR RESPECTIVE DISTRICT TO BE PLACED ON A MAILING LIST.  Contact information for the Chief Probation and Pretrial Services Officer may be obtained by using the court locator online at http://www.uscourts.gov/court_locator.aspx. The federal Judiciary intends to procure treatment services and/or Second Chance Act goods and services for federal defendants and persons under supervision using Blanket Purchase Agreements. Generally, the procurement of these services occurs during the summer months; however, procurement may occur at any time throughout the year depending on the needs of the district.  Solicitations for Blanket Purchase Agreements may be issued for districts in the United States and territories, including Alaska, Hawaii, District of Columbia, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico and U.S. Virgin Islands. Required Treatment Services may include, but are not limited to: urine collection, counseling (to include mental health, substance use, and or/sex offense treatment), physical examinations, outpatient and inpatient detoxification, medication, short and long term residential treatment, and transportation.   Required Second Chance Act goods and services may include, but are not limited to:  cognitive behavioral therapy, child-care, non-emergency medical services, computer hardware/software, identification, employee tools/equipment/licensure, transportation, transitional housing, domestic violence intervention, job training, etc.  These are examples of the types of services that may be procured.  The solicitation for Blanket Purchase Agreements would identify the specific services and requirements the offeror would be required to provide.  Interested providers must respond timely to solicitation deadlines and clearly show that (1) they can provide services, (2) such services will be provided by professionals meeting necessary requirements, and (3) prices of such services shall be as low as or lower than those charged to the treatment provider’s most favored customer for comparable quantities under similar terms and conditions. Place of Contract Performance: The United States and territories, including Alaska, Hawaii, District of Columbia, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, and U.S. Virgin Islands. Primary Point of Contact:  PPSO Treatment Services email at treatment_services_questions@ao.uscourts.gov.
NAICS: Outpatient Mental Health and Substance Abuse Centers

Title: Smokejumper Program Consulting Services
Description: This PRE-SOLICITATION SYNOPSIS NOTICE is for information and planning purposes only and does not constitute a formal Request for Quote (RFQ). This PRE-SOLICITATION SYNOPSIS NOTICE is not to be construed as a commitment by the Government. This is not a solicitation and does not obligate the Government to issue a solicitation, nor will the Government be liable for any costs involved in submission of information in response to this notice. Release of an official solicitation is anticipated to occur in May 2023. Interested parties are encouraged to monitor https://sam.gov/content/home for the release of the solicitation. The U.S. Forest Service (USFS) anticipates issuing a request for quote (RFQ), 1202SA23Q9806, to acquire consulting services to review the USFS smokejumper program. The U.S. Forest Service (USFS) made the determination to convert from the mix of round parachutes and Ram-Air parachutes, in its smokejumper program, to one that consists solely of Ram-Air parachutes. In December 2011 and updated in 2015, the USFS adopted a Change Management and Implementation Guide. The USFS completed a Change Management and Implementation Plan (V3) to guide this transition from the round parachute system to exclusive use of the USFS Ram-Air parachute system. The objective of these services is to complete an external review, analysis, and evaluation of the USFS Smokejumper Program’s change management and transition processes for the Ram-Air parachute transition and the current state of the program in the Ram-Air parachute transition to ensure future operational success. The Safety Management Systems (SMS) approach shall be utilized throughout the review, analysis, evaluation, and recommendation(s) of work performed under this purchase order. In addition, this purchase order is intended to obtain contractor services to provide coordination and communication with smokejumer participants; participate in meetings and document issues, take meeting minutes, and review status of the program; attend meetings/conference calls to provide technical analysis and consultation on program issues; review reports from meetings and provide an analysis on reports; travel to designated locations to observe and interview smokejumpers; distribute write-ups (e.g., reports, meeting minutes, technical data); and foster communication and sharing among the smokejumer program. Solicitation 1202SA23Q9806 will be competed as a total small business set-aside. The Government reserves the right to award with or without discussions. The Government intends to award this requirement as a Firm Fixed Price (FFP) purchase order with a base year, plus one (1) six-month option for additional meetings or site visits if required. If the Government does not receive an acceptable quote from a responsible small business, the Government reserves the right to award on an unrestricted (full and open competition) basis.
NAICS: Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services

Title: Building 1016 & Lodgepole Guard Station Roof Replacements
Description: The solicitation has two individual line items, which allows for up to two awardees as follows: Item A – Building 1016 The project includes all labor, materials, equipment, supplies, and incidentals necessary for the roof replacement of a bunkhouse located on the Wild Rivers Ranger District at the Illinois Valley Ranger Station located in Cave Junction, Oregon. The project includes but not limited to replacing the existing cedar shake roof with a metal roof. Item B – Lodgepole Guard Station The project includes all labor, materials, equipment, supplies, and incidentals necessary for the roof replacement of the Guard Station building located in the High Cascades Ranger District in Jackson County, Oregon. The project but not limited to replacing the cedar shingle roof with cedar shingles. Location: Item A – Building 1016 The Illinois Valley Ranger Station is located on the Rogue River-Siskiyou National Forest approximately 30 miles southwest of Grants Pass, Oregon along State Highway 199 (Redwood Hwy) Site Address: 26568 Redwood Hwy, Cave Junction Or, 97523 Item B – Lodgepole Guard Station The Lodgepole Guard Station is remote and located on the Rogue River-Sikiyou National Forest. Approximately 45 miles northeast of Medford, Oregon.
PSC: REPAIR OR ALTERATION OF OTHER ADMINISTRATIVE FACILITIES AND SERVICE BUILDINGS

Title: Roosevelt Harbor Dock Repairs
Description: The USDA Forest Service intends to issue a Request for Proposal (RFP) for rehabilitation/repair of Forest Service Marine Facilities in Wrangell. The work is located in Region 10, Tongass National Forest, Wrangell Ranger District within Southeast Alaska. The major construction efforts include securing services to repair various elements of the Roosevelt Harbor Floating dock. This includes but is not limited to piles, abutment, gangway, railings, mooring hardware, floats, and safety upgrades. The work includes but is not limited to piling repair, concrete float repair, addressing dock floatation, installation of a passive cathodic protection system, installing non-slip surfaces, replacing/reattaching various dock components/hardware, replacing wood decking, installing composite curb in place of deteriorated timber curb, metal components cleaning and painting, safety ladder reattaching and improving the fender system. Unless stated otherwise, all materials identified for replacement or repair, shall be in kind.   The contract period of performance will not exceed June 30, 2024.        The magnitude of this construction project is between $250,000.00 and $500,000.00.  A Bid Bond (20%) will be required of Offerors whose total price offer exceeds $150,000.  Performance and Payment Bonds (100% each) will be required of awardee for award greater than $150,000. The selection process, and evaluation criteria to be addressed, will be outlined in the forthcoming solicitation. The solicitation will be available for download exclusively via https://www.sam.gov on or about 5/17/2023. Paper copies of the solicitation will not be issued. Location: Item A – Building 1016 The Illinois Valley Ranger Station is located on the Rogue River-Siskiyou National Forest approximately 30 miles southwest of Grants Pass, Oregon along State Highway 199 (Redwood Hwy) Site Address: 26568 Redwood Hwy, Cave Junction Or, 97523 Item B – Lodgepole Guard Station The Lodgepole Guard Station is remote and located on the Rogue River-Sikiyou National Forest. Approximately 45 miles northeast of Medford, Oregon. Travel Directions: From Medford Interagency office, 3040 Biddle Road, Medford, OR 97504, turn right 0.1 miles to Lawnsdale Road, turn right 0.9 miles to Crater Lake Highway, OR-62, turn left 13.8 miles to Butte Falls Highway, continue for 16 miles to Butte Falls-Prospect Road, turn right onto Lodgepole Road (name changes to Forest Road 34), travel left onto Lodgepole Road for 1.5 mile to Lodgepole Guard Station on left, USFS 630. Access road USFS 630 has existing locked gate with combination lock. The selection process, and evaluation criteria to be addressed, will be outlined in the forthcoming solicitation.  The solicitation will be available for download exclusively via https://www.sam.gov on or about 05/03/2023.  Paper copies of the solicitation will not be issued.  The Government intends to award without discussions, however, reserves the right to conduct discussions should it be deemed in the Government’s best interest. One or two Firm Fixed-Price (FFP) contract will be awarded.  The contract period of performance will be : Item A – Building 1016 Complete the entire work ready for use no later than August 15, 2023 Item B – Lodgepole Guard Station The Anticipated period of performance is July 10th, 2023 – July 28th, 2023. The magnitude of this construction these projects are: Item A – Building 1016 $25,000 and $150,000 Item B – Lodgepole Guard Station $25,000 and $150,000 All offerors will be required to provide a Payment Bond (100%) for awards between $35,000 and $150,000 Note:  Per FAR 52.204-7(b)(1), System for Award Management (SAM), an Offeror is required to be registered in SAM when submitting an offer and shall continue to be registered until time of award, during performance, and through final payment for any contract resulting from this solicitation.  Information on registration may be obtained via:  https://www.sam.gov.  All Offerors must complete the electronic version of the Representations and Certifications in the SAM system. Description: AMENDMENT NOTICE: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 561720 with a small business size standard of $22.00M. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified offerors may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2023-05-19 13:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be Cassville, MO 65625 The Forest Service requires the following items, Meet or Exceed, to the following: Base Period of Performance: 06/01/2023 - 05/31/2024 LI 001: To perform janitorial duties at the Cassville Ranger District one day a week, preferably on Wednesday, within the hours of 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. The solicitation is for a Base plus two Option Years with satisfactory performance., 12, mo; Option 1 Period of Performance: 06/01/2024 - 05/31/2025 LI 001: To perform janitorial duties at the Cassville Ranger District one day a week, preferably on Wednesday, within the hours of 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. The building is approximately 1230 square foot (consist of 2 stories). The solicitation is for a Base plus two Option Years with satisfactory performance., 12, mo; Option 2 Period of Performance: 06/01/2025 - 05/31/2026 LI 001: To perform janitorial duties at the Cassville Ranger District one day a week, preferably on Wednesday, within the hours of 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. The solicitation is for a Base plus two Option Years with satisfactory performance., 12, mo; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested offerors must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, Forest Service intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. Forest Service is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerors that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerors that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerors that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerors may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should offerors require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. The site visit is to be held at the Cassville Ranger District, 601 State Hwy 248, Cassville, MO 65625. Site visit requirements: *Must have a valid state issued ID. Bid MUST be good for 30 calendar days after close of Buy. Registration information can be found at www.sam.gov.
